author: Anonymous Mouse
title: Alternative solution concat-starter solution
question:
I was wondering whether there is an alternative solution for a concat-starter solution. The first one is my code and the second is the solution code.
  (@template 2-one-of)

(define (concat los1 los2)
  (cond [(empty? los1) los2]
        [(empty? los2) los1]
        [else (append los1 los2)]))

(@template 2-one-of)

(define (concat lsta lstb)
  (cond [(empty? lstb) lsta] ;(1)
        [(empty? lsta) lstb] ;(2)
        [else                ;(3)
         (cons (first lsta)
               (concat (rest lsta) lstb))]))
instructor_answer:
concat is our name for append, so no we don't want you to use append.  If you could use append you could just write the following! :)
(define (concat a b) (append a b))
Or for that matter you could write:
(define concat append)
